channel.title: DevFreeBooks
channel.description: A collection of free books for devs

item.title: Free book: Construindo APIs testáveis com Node.js
item.description:
This ebook uses best practices examples about how to build Node.js and tests APIs; This is a guide for beginners and advanced developers.
Author: Waldemar Neto | Category: Node.js
Lang: BR | Pages: 200 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Artificial Intelligence with Python
item.description:
Artificial Intelligence is becoming increasingly relevant in the modern world where everything is driven by technology and data. It is used extensively across many fields such as search engines, image recognition, robotics, finance, and so on. We will explore various real-world scenarios in this book and you’ll learn about various algorithms that can be used to build Artificial Intelligence applications.
Author: Prateek Joshi | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 446 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: HTML5 Notes for Professionals book
item.description:
The HTML5 Notes for Professionals book is compiled from Stack Overflow Documentation, the content is written by the beautiful people at Stack Overflow. Text content is released under Creative Commons BY-SA. See credits at the end of this book whom contributed to the various chapters. Images may be copyright of their respective owners unless otherwise specified.
Author: GoalKicker | Category: HTML
Lang: EN | Pages: 122 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Swift Essentials - 2nd Edition
item.description:
Swift was considered one of the biggest innovations last year, and certainly with Swift 2 announced at WWDC in 2015, this segment of the developer space will continue to be hot and dominating. This is a fast-paced guide to provide an overview of Swift programming and then walks you through in detail how to write iOS applications. Progress through chapters on custom views, networking, parsing and build a complete application as a Git repository, all by using Swift as the core language
Author: Dr Alex Blewitt | Category: iOS
Lang: EN | Pages: 248 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: JavaScript Notes for Professionals book
item.description:
The JavaScript Notes for Professionals book is compiled from Stack Overflow Documentation, the content is written by the beautiful people at Stack Overflow. Text content is released under Creative Commons BY-SA.
Author: GoalKicker | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 480 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Sponsored book: Meteor - Construindo aplicações realtime com JavaScript
item.description:
JavaScript is nowadays a real choice for building server-side applications. Work with the same front-end language is a great advantage too. There are a lot of full-stack web frameworks, but Meteor is one that stand out. In this book, you will learn how to create a real-time social network, exploring the main native components of Meteor. Technically, you will learn how to build amazing templates using Handlebars, how to use Facebook API for sign-in and sign-up users, how to persist data into NoSQL MongoDB and how to develop an application using advanced concepts of reactive programming and Meteor PubSub.
Author: Caio Ribeiro Pereira | Category: Meteor
Lang: BR | Pages: 153 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: TypeScript Notes for Professionals book
item.description:
The TypeScript Notes for Professionals book is compiled from Stack Overflow Documentation, the content is written by the beautiful people at Stack Overflow. Text content is released under Creative Commons BY-SA. See credits at the end of this book whom contributed to the various chapters.
Author: GoalKicker | Category: TypeScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 97 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Sponsored book: Aplicações web realtime com Node.js
item.description:
Node.js is a powerful platform. It allows to write serve-side Javascript applications, making use of the language's syntax familiarity to write scalable applications. As Node.js makes use of an object-oriented model and events, focussed in non-blocking I/O, developing on it may be different to whom is used to traditional web applications. In this book, Caio Ribeiro Pereira breaks this wall, clearly showing this paradigm change, besides focusing in importante topics, the main API's and frameworks as Express and Socket.IO.
Author: Caio Ribeiro Pereira | Category: Node.js
Lang: BR | Pages: 185 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Think Perl 6 - How to think like a computer scientist
item.description:
Learn programming using the new Perl 6 programming language.
Author: Laurent Rosenfeld & Allen Downey | Category: Perl 6
Lang: EN | Pages: 440 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: SQL Server for C# Developers Succinctly
item.description:
Developers of C# applications with a SQL Server database can learn to connect to a database using classic ADO.NET and look at different methods of developing databases using the Entity Framework. This book addresses common pitfalls, why databases run slowly, how to troubleshoot performance issues, and how to test and deploy SQL Server databases. The first half has a focus on C# and development while the second half focuses on troubleshooting using the SQL Server tools.
Author: Sander Rossel | Category: Csharp
Lang: EN | Pages: 96 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Mastering Python
item.description:
Master the art of writing beautiful and powerful Python by using all of the features that Python 3.5 offers
Author: Rick van Hattem | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 486 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Mastering Python
item.description:
Master the art of writing beautiful and powerful Python by using all of the features that Python 3.5 offers
Author: Rick van Hattem | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 486 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Raspberry Pi cookbook for Python Programmers
item.description:
The Raspberry Pi Cookbook has over 50 tailor-made recipes for programmers to get the most out of Raspberry Pi using Python to unleash its huge potential.
Author: Tim Cox | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 402 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Android Security Cookbook
item.description:
Android Security Cookbook discusses many common vulnerabilities and security related shortcomings in Android applications and operating systems. The book breaks down and enumerates the processes used to exploit and remediate these vulnerabilities in the form of detailed recipes and walkthroughs.
Author: Keith Makan & Scott Alexander-Bown | Category: Android
Lang: EN | Pages: 350 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Python Data Science Handbook
item.description:
Essential Tools for Working with Data
Author: Jake VanderPlas | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 541 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Android NDK: Beginner's Guide - 2nd Edition
item.description:
Android NDK is all about injecting high-performance and portable code into your mobile apps by exploiting the maximum speed of the device they run on. This book will show you how to create C/C++-enabled mobile applications and integrate them with Java.
Author: Sylvain Ratabouil | Category: Android
Lang: EN | Pages: 494 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Advanced Machine Learning with Python
item.description:
Solve challenging data science problems by mastering cutting-edge machine learning techniques in Python.
Author: John Hearty | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 278 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: AngularJS Essentials
item.description:
Discover the best practices of the AngularJS framework and its most important concepts such as AngularJS directives, expressions, filters, and modules. This free eBook guides you through the steps of building your very own web application with AngularJS.
Author: Rodrigo Branas | Category: AngularJS
Lang: EN | Pages: 180 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Rails Testing Handbook
item.description:
Tired of fragile code? This free hands-on book will teach you how to build better Rails apps with confidence. Learn practical behavior-driven development (BDD) from the makers of Semaphore CI/CD.
Author: Marko Anastasov, Igor Šarčević | Category: Ruby On Rails
Lang: EN | Pages: 61 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Mastering iOS Game Development
item.description:
iOS is an operating system for Apple manufactured phones and tablets. Mobile gaming is one of the fastest-growing industries, and compatibility with iOS is now becoming the norm for game developers. SpriteKit is part of the native SDK from Apple, and enables developers to make simple entry into game development without unnecessary overhead and a long learning process.
Author: Miguel DeQuadros | Category: iOS
Lang: EN | Pages: 228 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Sponsored book: JavaScript Awesome Tips (Br Version)
item.description:
This is a cookbook with a collection of useful tips and tricks to apply in JavaScript/Node.js, each tip shows a problem and some magical solutions in pratical codes.
Author: Caio R Pereira | Category: JavaScript
Lang: BR | Pages: 40 | Year: 2018
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Thinking in JavaScript
item.description:
Get started with JavaScript and learn one of the most important languages in web development today. With helpful tips and code examples, discover how you can create websites with impressive and dynamic functionality. Explore JavaScript’s in-built features and find out how to customize them in this accessible and free guide.
Author: Aravind Shenoy | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 31 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Thinking in HTML
item.description:
Get started with JavaScript and learn one of the most important languages in web development today. With helpful tips and code examples, discover how you can create websites with impressive and dynamic functionality. Explore JavaScript’s in-built features and find out how to customize them in this accessible and free guide.
Author: Aravind Shenoy | Category: HTML
Lang: EN | Pages: 43 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Learning Python
item.description:
This book goes deeper than simply showing you how to build a Python app, giving you the fundamentals of Python programming that every developer needs to know to make the most of the language. Packed with tutorials and examples this title features everything from data structures, writing reusable code, testing, paradigms, and how Python can be adapted. This eBook will help transform you from a complete beginner to someone ready to bring the best out of their projects.
Author: Fabrizio Romano | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 443 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Neural Network Programming with Java
item.description:
Neural networks are very intelligent algorithmic systems. Learn how to create them with Java with this guide dedicated to cutting-edge neural network development.
Author: Alan M. Souza & Fabio M. Soares | Category: Java
Lang: EN | Pages: 244 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Building Machine Learning Systems with Python
item.description:
Expand your Python knowledge and learn all about machine-learning libraries in this user-friendly manual. ML is the next big breakthrough in technology and this book will give you the head-start you need.
Author: Willi Richert & Luis Pedro Coelho | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 290 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Think DSP
item.description:
Think DSP is an introduction to Digital Signal Processing in Python.
Author: Allen Downey | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 164 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist: C++
item.description:
The goal of this book is to teach you to think like a computer scientist. I like the way computer scientists think because they combine some of the best features of Mathematics, Engineering, and Natural Science. Like mathematicians, computer scientists use formal languages to denote ideas.
Author: Allen Downey | Category: C/C++
Lang: EN | Pages: 191 | Year: 2012
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Perl introductory course
item.description:
Introductory course for Perl 5 through examples, geared towards VLSI engineers.
Author: Sundeep Agarwal | Category: Perl
Lang: EN | Pages: 68 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Think OCalm
item.description:
How to Think Like a Computer Scientist is an introductory programming textbook based on the OCaml language. It is intended for newcomers to programming and also those who know some programming but want to learn programming in the function-oriented paradigm using OCaml.
Author: Allen Downey | Category: OCalm
Lang: EN | Pages: 142 | Year: 2008
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Vim Reference
item.description:
Vim reference guide for beginner to intermediate users
Author: Sundeep Agarwal | Category: Vim
Lang: EN | Pages: 39 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: HTML and CSS is hard
item.description:
A friendly web development tutorial for complete beginners.
Author: Oliver James | Category: HTML
Lang: EN | Pages: 200 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Think Python
item.description:
Think Python is an introduction to Python programming for beginners. It starts with basic concepts of programming, and is carefully designed to define all terms when they are first used and to develop each new concept in a logical progression. Larger pieces, like recursion and object-oriented programming are divided into a sequence of smaller steps and introduced over the course of several chapters.
Author: Allen Downey | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 244 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Think Java
item.description:
Think Java is an introduction to computer science and programming intended for people with little or no experience. We start with the most basic concepts and are careful to define all terms when they are first used.
Author: Allen Downey | Category: Java
Lang: EN | Pages: 291 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: SurviveJS React
item.description:
Learn React while building a Kanban application. Beginner-intermediate.
Author: Juho Vepsäläinen | Category: React
Lang: EN | Pages: 250 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: SurviveJS Webpack
item.description:
Learn webpack while building configuration and going through its features. Beginner-intermediate.
Author: Juho Vepsäläinen | Category: React
Lang: EN | Pages: 350 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: An Introduction to GCC
item.description:
This manual provides a tutorial introduction to the GNU C and C++ compilers, gcc and g++. Many books teach the C and C++ languages, this book explains how to use the compiler itself. Based on years of observation of questions posted on mailing lists, it guides the reader straight to the important options of GCC!
Author: Brian J. Gough | Category: C/C++
Lang: EN | Pages: 144 | Year: 2005
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The C Book, second edition
item.description:
This is not a tutorial introduction to C programming. The book is designed for programmers who already have some experience of using a modern high-level procedural programming language.
Author: Mike Banahan, Declan Brady and Mark Doran | Category: C/C++
Lang: EN | Pages: 333 | Year: 1991
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: JavaScript, ¡Inspírate!
item.description:
A simple and fun programming book that shows us how to program in JavaScript, from pseudocode to AJAX requests.
Author: Ulises Gascón | Category: JavaScript
Lang: ES | Pages: 149 | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Sponsored book: Building APIs with Node.js
item.description:
Learn how to build scalable APIs using the Node.js platform and ES6 (EcmaScript 2015) with this quick, informative guide. Developing systems for the wide range of devices available in the modern world requires the construction of APIs designed to work only with data in a centralized manner, allowing client-side applications to be developed separately and have a unique interface for the final user.
Author: Caio Ribeiro Pereira | Category: Node.js
Lang: EN | Pages: 137 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: ¡Aprende Haskell por el bien de todos!
item.description:
This is the spanish version of the book: Learn You a Haskell for Great Good.
Author: Álvaro Vilanova | Category: Haskell
Lang: ES | Pages: 400 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Clean Code concepts adapted for Javascript
item.description:
Software engineering principles, from Robert C. Martin's book Clean Code, adapted for JavaScript. This is not a style guide. It's a guide to producing readable, reusable, and refactorable software in JavaScript.
Author: Ryan McDermott | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 11 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The Vim Tutorial and Reference
item.description:
A complete ebook about Vim Tutorial and Vim References.
Author: Steve Oualline | Category: Vim
Lang: EN | Pages: 804 | Year: 2007
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Python Basics
item.description:
Introduction to Python - Syntax, working with Shell commands, Files, Text Processing, and more.
Author: Sundeep Agarwal | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 119 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Learn to Code HTML & CSS
item.description:
Learn to Code HTML & CSS is an interactive beginner’s guide with one express goal: teach you how to develop and style websites with HTML and CSS. Outlining the fundamentals, this book covers all of the common elements of front-end design and development.
Author: Shay Howe | Category: HTML
Lang: EN | Pages: 304 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The Road to learn React
item.description:
A lot of roadmaps exist on how to master React. This book uses the common sense of these roads and weaves it into the implementation of an attractive real world app. You will build a React app, which consumes the Hacker News API. On the road you will learn ES6, React with all its basics and advanced concepts and internal state management.
Author: Robin Wieruch | Category: React
Lang: EN | Pages: 101 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Programming in D
item.description:
This book aims to teach the D language to readers who are new to computer programming. Although having experience in other programming languages would certainly be helpful, this book starts from the basics.
Author: Ali Çehreli | Category: D
Lang: EN | Pages: 760 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: D Programming Language Specification
item.description:
This is the specification for the D Programming Language.
Author: D Lang | Category: D
Lang: EN | Pages: 552 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Object-Oriented Programming in C
item.description:
Use ANSI C to discover how object-oriented programming is done, what its techniques are, why they help solve bigger problems, and how to harness generality and program to catch mistakes earlier.
Author: Axel Schreiner | Category: C/C++
Lang: EN | Pages: 221 | Year: 1994
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Clojure for the brave and true
item.description:
Complete, entertaining introduction to Clojure.
Author: Daniel Higginbotham | Category: Clojure
Lang: EN | Pages: 328 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Speaking JavaScript: An In-Depth Guide for Programmers
item.description:
Speaking JavaScript helps you approach the language with four standalone sections. First, a quick-start guide teaches you just enough of the language to help you be productive right away. More experienced JavaScript programmers will find a complete and easy-to-read reference that covers each language feature in depth.
Author: Dr. Axel Rauschmayer | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 460 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The Type Astronaut’s Guide to Shapeless
item.description:
This book is a guide to using shapeless¹, a library for generic programming in Scala.
Author: Dave Gurnell | Category: Scala
Lang: EN | Pages: 107 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: The OCaml System: Documentation and User's Manual
item.description:
This the official User's Manual. It serves as a complete reference guide to OCaml. Updated for each version of OCaml, it contains the description of the language, of its extensions, and the documentation of the tools and libraries included in the official distribution.
Author: Damien Doligez, Alain Frisch, Jacques Garrigue, Didier Rémy and Jérôme Vouillon | Category: OCalm
Lang: EN | Pages: 554 | Year: 2012
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Real World OCaml
item.description:
This hands-on book shows you how to take advantage of OCaml’s functional, imperative, and object-oriented programming styles with recipes for many real-world tasks.
Author: Jason Hickey, Anil Madhavapeddy, and Yaron Minsky | Category: OCalm
Lang: EN | Pages: 510 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Stuff Goes Bad: Erlang in Anger
item.description:
This book intends to be a little guide about how to be the Erlang medic in a time of war. It is first and foremost a collection of tips and tricks to help understand where failures come from, and a dictionary of different code snippets and practices that helped developers debug production systems that were built in Erlang.
Author: Fred Hebert | Category: Erlang
Lang: EN | Pages: 93 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Unix System Programming in OCaml
item.description:
This is an excellent book on Unix system programming, with an emphasis on communications between processes. The main novelty of this work is the use of OCaml, instead of the C language that is customary in systems programming. This gives an unusual perspective on systems programming and on OCaml.
Author: Xavier Leroy and Didier Rémy | Category: OCalm
Lang: EN | Pages: 138 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: High Performance Browser Networking
item.description:
You’ll then dive into performance characteristics of technologies such as HTTP 2.0, client-side network scripting with XHR, real-time streaming with SSE and WebSocket, and P2P communication with WebRTC.
Author: Ilya Grigorik | Category: Network Protocols
Lang: EN | Pages: 400 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Using, Understanding, and Unraveling OCaml
item.description:
This book describes both the OCaml language and the theoretical grounds behind its powerful type system.
Author: Didier Rémy | Category: OCalm
Lang: EN | Pages: 174 | Year: 2001
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Threading in C#
item.description:
An extensive article on multithreading in C#. This tackles difficult issues such as thread safety, when to use Abort, Wait Handles vs Wait and Pulse, the implications of Apartment Threading in Windows Forms, using Thread Pooling, Synchronization Contexts, Memory Barriers and non-blocking synchronization constructs.
Author: Joseph Albahari | Category: Csharp
Lang: EN | Pages: 125 | Year: 2011
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Higher-Order Perl
item.description:
Higher-Order Perl is about functional programming techniques in Perl. It's about how to write functions that can modify and manufacture other functions.
Author: Mark Jason Dominus | Category: Perl
Lang: EN | Pages: 592 | Year: 2005
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Mostly Adequate Guide to Functional Programming
item.description:
Learn the functional programming paradigm using the world's most popular functional programming language: JavaScript.
Author: Frisby | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 62 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Web2Py
item.description:
Web2py is an open source python web development framework.
Author: Massimo Di Pierro | Category: Python
Lang: EN | Pages: 614 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Pro Git
item.description:
Pro Git is your fully-updated guide to Git and its usage in the modern world. Git has come a long way since it was first developed by Linus Torvalds for Linux kernel development. This book teaches you how to use it like a pro.
Author: Scott Chacon & Ben Straub | Category: Git
Lang: EN | Pages: 456 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Learn You Some Erlang for Great Good!
item.description:
Erlang is the language of choice for programmers who want to write robust, concurrent applications, but its strange syntax and functional design can intimidate the uninitiated. Luckily, there’s a new weapon in the battle against Erlang-phobia: Learn You Some Erlang for Great Good!
Author: Fred Hebert | Category: Erlang
Lang: EN | Pages: 624 | Year: 2013
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Ruby Web Dev: The Other Way
item.description:
This guide is an attempt to describe the way to build the web app with a real understanding of each component, with knowledge that is relevant in any web language and framework. To become a better web developer and demand for a better ecosystem!
Author: Ievgen Kuzminov | Category: Ruby
Lang: EN | Pages: 60 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: JavaScript Allongé, the "Six" Edition
item.description:
A long pull of functions, combinators, & decorators, updated to include the latest ES-6 features.
Author: Reginald Braithwaite | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 513 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Exploring ES6
item.description:
An in-depth book on ECMAScript 6, for JavaScript programmers.
Author: Axel Rauschmayer | Category: JavaScript
Lang: EN | Pages: 620 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Pocket Guide to Writing SVG
item.description:
A pocket guide to writing SVG.
Author: Joni Trythall | Category: svg
Lang: EN | Pages: 1 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: SCALABLE, un libro sobre SVG
item.description:
A lo largo de 15 capítulos, 120 páginas y más de 70 ejemplos vamos a ver todo lo que podemos hacer con SVG.
Author: Jorge Aznar | Category: svg
Lang: ES | Pages: 146 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: HTML5 for Web Designers
item.description:
HTML5 isn’t as confusing as it once was, but it still isn’t straightforward. It’s an evolutionary, rather than revolutionary, change in the ongoing story of markup—and if you’re currently creating websites with any version of HTML, you’re already using HTML5.
Author: Jeremy Keith & Rachel Andrew | Category: HTML
Lang: EN | Pages: 92 | Year: 2010
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Build Pacman
item.description:
Learn Modern Javascript, HTML5 Canvas, and a bit of Ember.js. This is a book about surviving an alien invasion and using web technologies.
Author: Jeffrey Biles | Category: Ember.js
Lang: EN | Pages: 189 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Vim para Noobs
item.description:
A free GitBook about Vim editor for Noobs become text hackers.
Author: William Oliveira | Category: Vim
Lang: BR | Pages: 38 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Getting Started With Git - DZone Refcard
item.description:
This updated Refcard explains why so many developers are migrating to this exciting platform. Learn about creating a new Git repository, cloning existing projects, the remote workflow, and more to pave the way for limitless content version control.
Author: Matthew McCullough & Kurt Collins | Category: Git
Lang: EN | Pages: 6 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Swift Essentials - DZone Refcard
item.description:
Get ahead of the fastest growing programming language. Swift is an open source, type-safe, object-oriented programming language that is used for more than client-side mobile apps. It is designed for developers to have an easier time writing and maintaining accurate code.
Author: Alex Blewitt | Category: iOS
Lang: EN | Pages: 6 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Caio Ribeiro Pereira

item.title: Free book: Core Java - DZone Refcard
item.description:
